means: （犬、马等后腿的）跗关节，（鸡的）腿关节

word_mean: 后踝：马或牛后腿的跗关节或跗区

sentence.Network_en: Even company directors on £100,000 a year can be deeply in hock to the banks.
sentence.Network_cn: 即便是年薪10万英镑的公司董事也可能欠银行很多债。

sentence.Network_en: It is almost impossible for the prime minister to stand above the factions. He always seems in hock to one or another.
sentence.Network_cn: 总理想要不受各派系的影响几乎是不可能的。他好像总是为某一派所牵制。

sentence.Network_en: It was spring, and our padded clothes had just been placed in hock.
sentence.Network_cn: 这是个春天, 我们的棉衣都刚脱下来就人了当铺.

derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English: variant of hough
abbreviation of obsolete hockamore, alteration of German Hochheimer (Wein) ('wine) from Hochheim'
mid 19th cent. (in the phrase in hock): from Dutch hok 'hutch, prison, debt'

entry.tran: 霍克酒（德国产的一种干白葡萄酒）
entry.def: Hock is a type of dry white wine from Germany.
The hock of an animal, especially a horse, is the joint in its back leg that points backwards.
A hock is a piece of meat from above the foot of an animal, especially a pig.

example.ex: ...ham hocks with garlic and mustard sauce.
example.tran: 配蒜蓉芥末酱汁的蹄膀

entry.def: If someone is in hock, they are in debt.

example.ex: Even company directors on £100,000 a year can be deeply in hock to the banks.
example.tran: 即便是年薪10万英镑的公司董事也可能欠银行很多债。

entry.def: If you are in hock to someone, you feel you have to do things for them because they have given you money or support.

example.ex: It is almost impossible for the prime minister to stand above the factions. He always seems in hock to one or another.
example.tran: 总理想要不受各派系的影响几乎是不可能的。他好像总是为某一派所牵制。

means.word_mean: 1. any of several white wines from the Rhine River valley in Germany (`hock' is British usage)
2. tarsal joint of the hind leg of hoofed mammals; corresponds to the human ankle
1. leave as a guarantee in return for money;
